Line 52: Line 52:
Samsung mobile released a teaser video<ref>[http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=oM9RO-GAKjE YouTube: SAMSUNG Mobile Unpacked 2011 - Google Episode Teaser Video]</ref> for its "Google Episode" of Unpacked on 11 October<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/05/samsung-teases-next-weeks-unpacked-offers-a-momentary-glance/ Samsung teases next week's 'Unpacked,' offers a momentary glance at a mysterious device]</ref> but later postponed the product announcement out of respect to 18 October,<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/07/samsung-and-google-postpone-ice-cream-sandwich-and-galaxy-nexus/ Samsung and Google postpone Ice Cream Sandwich and Galaxy Nexus]</ref><ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/13/samsung-confirms-ice-cream-sandwich-event-on-october-19/ Engadget: Samsung confirms Ice Cream Sandwich event on October 19]</ref> following the death of [[Apple Inc.]] co-founder [[Steve Jobs]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Samsung Nexus Prime smartphone delay is 'Jobs tribute'|url=https://encrypted.google.com/url?url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-15236915&rct=j&sa=X&ei=ch6TTo_7I6TXiALi99zmCw&ved=0CDYQ-AsoATAA&q=nexus+prime&usg=AFQjCNExSHgoJsLA54a7k7mVGA7r6xYWjA&cad=rja|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=10 October 2011}}</ref>
Samsung mobile released a teaser video<ref>[http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=oM9RO-GAKjE YouTube: SAMSUNG Mobile Unpacked 2011 - Google Episode Teaser Video]</ref> for its "Google Episode" of Unpacked on 11 October<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/05/samsung-teases-next-weeks-unpacked-offers-a-momentary-glance/ Samsung teases next week's 'Unpacked,' offers a momentary glance at a mysterious device]</ref> but later postponed the product announcement out of respect to 18 October,<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/07/samsung-and-google-postpone-ice-cream-sandwich-and-galaxy-nexus/ Samsung and Google postpone Ice Cream Sandwich and Galaxy Nexus]</ref><ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/13/samsung-confirms-ice-cream-sandwich-event-on-october-19/ Engadget: Samsung confirms Ice Cream Sandwich event on October 19]</ref> following the death of [[Apple Inc.]] co-founder [[Steve Jobs]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Samsung Nexus Prime smartphone delay is 'Jobs tribute'|url=https://encrypted.google.com/url?url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-15236915&rct=j&sa=X&ei=ch6TTo_7I6TXiALi99zmCw&ved=0CDYQ-AsoATAA&q=nexus+prime&usg=AFQjCNExSHgoJsLA54a7k7mVGA7r6xYWjA&cad=rja|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=10 October 2011}}</ref>
â
==Hardware and software==
+
==Hardware==
â
It is the first device to run [[Android (operating system)|Android]] [[Android version history#4.x Ice Cream Sandwich|4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich)]],<ref name="yahoo143600226">[http://news.yahoo.com/googles-nexus-prime-android-4-0-ice-cream-143600226.html Google's 'Nexus Prime' with Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich allegedly set for October release]</ref> and is expected to feature 4.65-inch 1280Ã720-pixel [[Super AMOLED]] HD with curved glass,<ref name="engadget20111006"/> a dual-core 1.2 GHz [[Texas Instruments OMAP|Ti OMAP]] 4460 processor (ARM Cortex-A9)<ref name="bgr20111006"/> with an accompanying [[PowerVR]] SGX540<ref>[http://focus.ti.com/general/docs/wtbu/wtbuproductcontent.tsp?contentId=53243&navigationId=12843&templateId=6123 OMAPâ¢ 4 Platform: OMAP4430/OMAP4460]</ref>, 1024 MB of RAM, a 1750 mAh battery, 1.3 MP front camera and 5 MP rear camera capable of [[1080p]] video,<ref name="engadget20111006"/>, [[4G]], [[Wi-Fi]] a/b/g/n, [[Bluetooth]], [[Global Positioning System|GPS]], [[Barometer]], and [[Near field communication|NFC]].<ref name="brighthand18084"/>
+
The Galaxy Nexus is expected to feature 4.65-inch 1280Ã720-pixel [[Super AMOLED]] HD with curved glass,<ref name="engadget20111006"/> a dual-core 1.2 GHz [[Texas Instruments OMAP|Ti OMAP]] 4460 processor (ARM Cortex-A9)<ref name="bgr20111006"/> with an accompanying [[PowerVR]] SGX540<ref>[http://focus.ti.com/general/docs/wtbu/wtbuproductcontent.tsp?contentId=53243&navigationId=12843&templateId=6123 OMAPâ¢ 4 Platform: OMAP4430/OMAP4460]</ref>, 1024 MB of RAM, a 1750 mAh battery, 1.3 MP front camera and 5 MP rear camera capable of [[1080p]] video,<ref name="engadget20111006"/>, [[4G]], [[Wi-Fi]] a/b/g/n, [[Bluetooth]], [[Global Positioning System|GPS]], [[Barometer]], and [[Near field communication|NFC]].<ref name="brighthand18084"/>
The phone has no physical buttons on the front, and instead features on-screen soft keys embedded into the system software. The 3.5mm headphone jack is located on the bottom of the phone, and the camera is located in the centre of the rear side. The phone does not feature a [[microSD]] slot for storage expansion, and will have 16GB/32GB internal storage depending on model.<ref>18 October 2011, [http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsung-galaxy-nexus-hands-on/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus with Ice Cream Sandwich hands-on], Engadget</ref>
The phone has no physical buttons on the front, and instead features on-screen soft keys embedded into the system software. The 3.5mm headphone jack is located on the bottom of the phone, and the camera is located in the centre of the rear side. The phone does not feature a [[microSD]] slot for storage expansion, and will have 16GB/32GB internal storage depending on model.<ref>18 October 2011, [http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsung-galaxy-nexus-hands-on/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus with Ice Cream Sandwich hands-on], Engadget</ref>
  +   +
==Software==
  +
